page.title: 06Farming: Trewinnard Manor
page.content: The house and lands taken from Rufus then passed to a Knight called Moon, later one of the Moons from the female side married into the Hawkins family. The last of the Hawkins family locally died out in the early part of this century. The Hawkins family have their own Trewinnard Chapel in the Parish Church of St.Erth. Currently Sir John and Lady Nott are occupiers, Sir John was Mrs Thatchers Secretary of State for Defence in the Falklands war of l982. They farm l5O acres mainly given over to 4OO Dorset Sheep, known as milk sheep owing to their fecundity, several twin, triplet and a few quadruplet lambs being born every year. Many of these are taken to Market after only 3 months. Shearing of the sheep takes place in the period April to May.
